intro: Hieracium stenopolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides, meadows, and grasslands. It features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow disc flowers that bloom in the summer. Hieracium stenopolium is often found in sunny, well-drained soils and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
